author: Outlook Web Desk
title: Heatwave Drives Coal Power And Emissions To Record Highs In India
text:
The first quarter of 2024 has seen the generation of coal-fired power and emissions scale new, alarming highs in India amidst a sweeping heatwave and a decline in hydropower generation
Far from tapering, India's consumption of fossil fuel-fired energy and resulting emissions hit an all-time high in the first quarter of 2024, driven by a heatwave and reduced hydropower generation. Coal-fired power, which is still 70 percent of India's energy output, shot up by
India, which still relies on coal for over 70 percent of its electricity output, saw its coal-fired power generation jump by 9.6 percent year-over-year to 338 terawatt hours (TWh) in the first quarter of 2024. Alongside, total power sector emissions spiralled by 316 MMT of CO2 and other toxic gases.
The year started with a surge in coal-fired units amid a prolonged heatwave and above-normal temperatures, which significantly increased electricity consumption. This was further fueled by the continued rise in power demand, a clear indicator of the country's expanding economic growth. The demand for thermal power heightened further because of the fall in hydropower output by 11 percent in March.
Grid Controller of India data indicates that the share of coal in India's power generation increased to 77 percent during the first week of April, marking a rise of roughly 2 percentage points when compared to the same period in 2023.

author: Nancy Jacques, Northeast side
title: Letter: Leaders' rhetoric help border smugglers
text: Re: the Dec. 24 article "Rumors, headlines factor in border rush." Thanks to Emily Bregel, for this article. Her report Christmas Eve? Politicians’ untruthful rhetoric and then news disseminating their misinformation don’t escape news-savvy people in the Americas. Statements we’ve heard, like “open borders” offer smugglers huge paydays from people dreaming of such opportunities, affirmed by American leaders’ quotes. Wouldn’t you act if you were desperate? Add rumors smugglers create, implicitly supported in December by Congress not moving on support for “CBP One Application” or personnel. Smugglers say the Program is closing. “Don’t apply and wait, just come.” Frustrated? Write Republican Rep. Ciscomani. Ask him what he’s been saying! Our Senators are working for solutions. Yet Republicans want immigration “broken.” Fundraising for 2024; “It’s all Biden’s fault.” Yet the Biden Administration’s Homeland Security Application Process initially slowed the migration process! Trump’s $15 billion wall? Impotent! Buy a $100 reciprocating saw. Wall breaching has occurred thousands of times, costing millions more for repairs. Republicans: Tell the truth! Cooperate! People are also reading… Nancy Jacques Northeast side Disclaimer: As submitted to the Arizona Daily Star.

organizations.name: biden administration’s homeland security application process

author: sina_mobile
title: 有了电工证，外出找工作就有底气了！普陀区深化沪滇劳务协作交流_手机新浪网
text:
有了电工证，外出找工作就有底气了！普陀区深化沪滇劳务协作交流
（来源：上观新闻）
陈阳礼是云南省巧家县小河镇普谷村伙房社村民，从他家到镇上开车要50分钟，再到县里则需3个半小时。过去，他多次外出找工作都因缺乏技能而碰壁，“要么老板不要，要么给的工资很低工作还很累，只能在周边村组打零工，务工收入时有时无。”生活的困境让他渴望改变，却苦于没有机会。
转机出现在今年6月。通过前期精准排摸，了解到当地群众技能培训需求后，普陀区专门为小河镇普谷村送来了电工培训班，陈阳礼成为了其中一名学员。培训结束后，巧家县人社部门接续深化服务，帮助陈阳礼顺利拿到了电工证。
“这次普陀区把电工培训送到我家门口，我第一时间就报名。现在掌握了一门技术，有了电工证，以后再外出找工作就有底气了！听说我们培训的费用还是普陀区帮扶我们的，真希望有机会当面对他们说一声感谢！”陈阳礼高兴地说。
而这，只是普陀区开展沪滇劳务协作职业技能培训工作的一个缩影。
为深入贯彻落实党中央关于东西部协作的重要决策部署，进一步巩固拓展脱贫攻坚成果，全面推进乡村振兴，普陀区深化沪滇劳务协作交流，以技能帮扶助力当地劳动力提升岗位技能，开展送教上门系列活动，让群众在家门口学到实用技能，实现就业稳定、收入稳定，真正达到“培训一人、就业一人、致富一户”的目的。
自2021年以来，普陀区与巧家县人社局紧扣覆盖面更广、效果更好”两大目标，围绕当地产业发展需要、劳动力市场需求和群众意愿三大着力点，坚持理论与实操相结合的培训模式，合作开展沪滇劳务协作职业技能培训8场，涵盖家政服务员、养老护理员、电工等多个实用技能课程，累计培训人员400余人次。巧家县人社局也结合当地劳动力技能提升实际，开展家门口的技能培训服务，投入沪滇协作资金126万元，培训脱贫劳动力3000余人次，为固拓展脱贫攻坚成果，推进乡村振兴提供了强大人力人才支撑。
接下来，普陀区将持续深入推进沪滇劳务协作工作，拓展和优化技能培训项目，探索建立“对接需求-精准培训-定向输送-稳定就业”的全过程协作链条，让更多的群众在家门口就能学到实用技能，拥有一技之长。
原标题：《有了电工证，外出找工作就有底气了！普陀区深化沪滇劳务协作交流》
栏目主编：王嘉旖 文字编辑：占悦
来源：作者：文汇报 张晓鸣

author: Ryan Hodges
title: No green thumb? Tips for aspiring gardeners this Spring
text:
No green thumb? Tips for aspiring gardeners this Spring
JACKSON, Tenn. — Spring is officially here and many people may want to get out to the garden.
Not everyone has the resources for a giant garden or greenhouse in their backyard. Some people live in apartments, or have very small yards. That should not stop you from gardening, as there are other ways you can get involved.
“You can garden in your flowerbed, you can garden in buckets, you can build a raised bed, some people even garden in bails of wheat straw,” said Ginger Kemp, owner of
R & J Feed Supply. “It’s just open ended possibilities that you can garden without having a large garden that you have to till up and things like that.”
If you have never done any gardening before, Kemp gives us some great tips and advice to make sure we start off right.
“You want a plant that has a really sturdy, like a stalk on it,” Kemp said. “So it is really easy for you to plant without having to break it off and things like that. When you put it in your soil, you want to plant it deep so you’ll have a good root system established.”
This can help make sure it does not get damaged by the wind. Kemp says it is also important to have good quality soil so your plants can flourish.
Kemp also says that if you have thought about gardening, you should simply give it a shot.
“The big thing is don’t be scared to try. If you don’t try, then you don’t succeed or fail. That is one of my personal things. When I go home at night I love to work in the yard or work in the garden,” said Kemp.
She also says that it is a great tool for children, learning how to take care of a plant and watching it grow.
If you want to learn more, you can contact your local Ag center to ask any questions that you may have.
For more local news,
click here.

author: Reuters
title: Rescuers rescue four more mariners from Houthi-struck ship, 11 still missing | MarketScreener India
text:
ATHENS (Reuters) -Rescuers pulled three more crew members and a security guard alive from the Red Sea on Thursday, maritime security sources said, a day after Houthi militants sank the Greek ship Eternity C and said they were holding some of the crew still missing.
This brings the total number of those rescued so far to 10, including eight Filipino crew members, one Indian and one Greek security guard. The people found on Thursday had spent more than 48 hours in the water. Another 11 people are still missing.
"This fills us with more courage to continue to search for those missing, as the Greek vessel operator requested, and shows that our search plan was correct," said Nikos Georgopoulos, an official at the Greece-based maritime risk firm Diaplous.
Eternity C is the second Greek bulk carrier sunk this week by the Iran-aligned Houthi militia in Yemen. The attacks, which Houthis say are an act of solidarity with Palestinians in the Gaza war, have ended months of calm in the area.
The United States' Mission in Yemen has accused the Houthis of kidnapping crew members and has called for their immediate release.
On Wednesday, the Houthis' military spokesperson said in a televised address that the Yemeni navy had "responded to rescue a number of the ship's crew, provide them with medical care, and transport them to a safe location".
The Eternity C sank on Wednesday days after Houthis hit and sunk the Magic Seas, reviving a campaign launched in November 2023 that has seen more than 100 ships attacked.
Both of the vessels hit this week flew Liberian flags and were operated by Greek companies. All crew from the Magic Seas were rescued before it went down.
Eternity C was first hit on Monday with sea drones and rocket-propelled grenades fired from speed boats. Four people are presumed dead, with maritime security sources saying they were killed in the attacks. If confirmed, the deaths would be the first fatalities in the area since June 2024.
Following a second attack on Tuesday morning, the crew were forced to jump into the water. Rescuers have been searching for them since Wednesday morning.
The vessel's operator, Cosmoship Management, has not responded to Reuters' requests for comment.
(Reporting by Renee Maltezou and Yannis Souliotis in Athens and Jonathan Saul in LondonEditing by Gareth Jones)
By Renee Maltezou
Share © Reuters - 2025

author: @Dailyhuntapp
title: Is Kundali Bhagya Star Sana Sayyad Expecting Her First Child With Husband Imaad Shamsi?
text:
Sana Sayyad, who shot to fame with the show, Kundali Bhagya, is reportedly expecting her first child with husband Imaad Shamsi. A report published in a leading portal suggests that the actress is pregnant with her first child. However, the couple has not made any official announcements about their pregnancy. For those who've come in late, Sana Sayyad and Imaad Shamsi tied the knot in 2021.
Sana Sayyad and Imaad Shamsi to welcome their first child?
Sana has not yet officially announced her pregnancy with Imaad Shamsi. Apart from that, it is still not clear if the actress will continue shooting for Kundali Bhagya or not. Her fans have many questions on their minds.
View this post on Instagram A post shared by Sana Sayyad (@sana_sayyad29)
\n A report on Gossip TV also suggests that Sana Sayyad is expected to quit the Kundali Bhagya show due to her pregnancy. However, there is no official confirmation about the same.
About Sana Sayyad
Sana Sayyad has been receiving a lot of love for her performance in Kundali Bhagya. Her on-screen chemistry with Paras Kalnawat is being loved by all.
Sana started her career by participating in Splitsvilla 8 as a contestant. She emerged as the first runner-up on the show, along with Utkarsh Gupta. Later, she worked on Crime Patrol, Girls On Top and other shows. She got a big break in 2019.
Sana was cast in Divya Drishti, which starred Adhvik Mahajan and Nyrraa Banerji. The actress also worked in the show Spy Bahu opposite Sehban Azim. After wrapping up the show, Sana started working in Kundali Bhagya in 2023. Since then, she has been receiving a lot of love from the masses.

author: Bertha Teresa Ramírez
title: La Jornada - Trabajadores del Metro protestan por incumplimiento de servicio médico
text:
Ciudad de México. Trabajadores del Metro demandaron al Director del Metro, Guillermo Calderón Aguilera y al titular de Administración y Finanzas del gobierno capitalino, Juan Pablo de Botton Falcón, se ejerza el presupuesto autorizado al Sistema de Transporte Colectivo, “para que se cumplan con las obligaciones laborales de Seguridad Social, como son los servicios médicos, laboratorios y medicamentos, en beneficio de los 15 mil trabajadores del Metro y sus derechohabientes”.
En protesta por la falta de pago a la prestación laboral de los servicios médicos, los trabajadores han colocado en estaciones, taquillas y trenes cárteles en los que demandan el pago puntual del servicio médico, así como el respeto al derecho a la salud de las y los trabajadores.
Al respecto , el Sindicato Nacional de Trabajadores del Sistema de Transporte Colectivo, exigió, el pago puntual inmediato de los servicios Médicos y no se violente el derecho a la salud de las y los trabajadores.
Mediante cartulinas, los trabajadores exigen “el pago puntualmente de los servicios médicos”, y que se respeten los derechos laborales adquiridos por más de 52 años.

author: Jmilrud Community Member
title: Nest only showing heat mode no cooling mode
text:
5m ago
Hi everyone , my nest been working over the winter no problem and yesterday it was starting to be summer weather and for some reason my nest only shows heat in the mode selection i do live in a condo where the air condition hasn't been switched on by the building not sure if this effects.
